alert.note: Alert for Lancaster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 11 at 4:54PM CDT until June 11 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN LANCASTER...CENTRAL SALINE AND NORTHWESTERN GAGE COUNTIES... At 453 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 8 miles south of Dorchester, or 26 miles north of Fairbury, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and two inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Wilber, Western, Swanton, The Highway 41 and 15 South Junction and Swan Creek Wildlife Management Area. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
